item.title: The Ripple Effects of Granting Status Awards on Coauthors.
item.description:
Reviewed relevant research on collaborative networks of scientists, focusing on the status spillovers: the effect of granting status awards on coauthors.

Matched 7 million data related to the publications and citations of prize winners and their coauthors.

Investigated the impact of prize on the citation rates of both winner and their coauthors’ articles.

Explored the impact of awards prestige, awarded fields, award year, publication year, gender, and age of winners on citation changes for winners and coauthors.

item.title: Transmission Mechanism of Geopolitical Risks on the Energy Market.
item.description:
Reviewed 80+ research papers and reports, gaining valuable insights into the crude oil market's geopolitical risk perspective.

Developed a pioneering two-stage approach, integrating statistics, econometrics, macroeconomics, and behavioral finance theories, to analyze geopolitical risk transmission to the crude oil market.

Utilized the time-varying parametric vector autoregressive (TVPVAR) model to demonstrate how geopolitical risk influences oil prices through various transmission paths, including micro and macro media.

Identified two distinct geopolitical transmission paths-speculative behavior and economic activity–to enhance energy-related decision-making.

Authored the paper “Transmission Mechanisms of Geopolitical Risks to the Crude Oil Market-a pioneering two-stage geopolitical risk analysis approach,” as the first author.

item.title: Geopolitical Risks Diffusion in Energy Market:A Neural Network Perspective.
item.description:
Analyzed 20+ papers on financial systems from a complex network perspective, focusing on stability, risk contagion, and immunization.

Attempted to employ Graph Attention Network (GAT) to predict oil price, incorporating geopolitical factors for unique insights into the energy market dynamics.

item.title: Application of Game Theory in Environmental Economics.
item.description:
Reviewed 20+ papers on evolutionary games, behavioral games, multistage games, and game-theoretic dynamics applied to low-carbon strategies, energy trading, and global climate action, informing innovative frameworks for sustainable practices.

Analyzed the stability of climate coalitions and environmental agreements using game theory, revealing the vital role of international cooperation in mitigating climate change.

item.title: Management of Energy Systems for Sustainable Development.
item.description:
Conducted in-depth review of 20+ papers & reports (e.g., WB, IPCC, IMF) on circular economy, energy transition, international energy policy, net zero strategy, and sustainable development.

Analyzed green finance's role in driving renewable energy investment & authored insightful essay on energy transition opportunities & threats, providing recommendations for stakeholders.

item.title: Robust inference of mixed regression model based on non-convex penalty likelihood method.
item.description:
Developed a novel and robust logistic regression method by introducing a mean-shift parameter, improving predictive performance significantly.

Assisted to design an innovative iteration-based threshold embedded [Î˜-IPOD] algorithm for concurrent outlier detection and robust parameter estimation.

Identified key factors impacting consumer decision-making, including gender, recommendations, and web celebrities’ information quality.

Authored the paper “Robust Logistic Regression Model and Its Empirical Results Based on Nonconvex Penalized Regression” as first author.
